Sentencas: The stability of Sm0.5Sr0.5CoO3 (SSC) under reduction conditions is investigated to determine whether it can be used as a cathode material in on-planar type, single-chamber, solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Phase stability of Sm0.5Sr0.5CoO3 cathodes for on-planar type, single-chamber, solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The techniques of X-ray diffraction, X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy and scanning electron microscopy are used to reveal the reduction mechanism of SSC.
Titulo: Phase stability of Sm0.5Sr0.5CoO3 cathodes for on-planar type, single-chamber, solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Impedance spectroscopy analysis also provides a better understanding of the influence of decomposed SSC phases oil cathode performance.
Titulo: Phase stability of Sm0.5Sr0.5CoO3 cathodes for on-planar type, single-chamber, solid oxide fuel cells

Titulo: Phase stability of Sm0.5Sr0.5CoO3 cathodes for on-planar type, single-chamber, solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The SSC perovskite structure is destroyed at 350 degrees C ill pure hydrogen.
Titulo: Phase stability of Sm0.5Sr0.5CoO3 cathodes for on-planar type, single-chamber, solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: There is a catastrophic microstructural change in which SSC is completely decomposed to SrO and CoO that cover the surface of Sm2O3.
Titulo: Phase stability of Sm0.5Sr0.5CoO3 cathodes for on-planar type, single-chamber, solid oxide fuel cells
